thread.section_title: US News, Breaking News and Headlines - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Trump Asks Advisers to Study Rejoining Pacific Trade Pact Talks

author: Michael C. Bender
title: Trump Asks Advisers to Study Rejoining Pacific Trade Pact Talks
text:
WASHINGTON—A little over a year after withdrawing the U.S. from the Trans-Pacific Partnership, President Donald Trump has asked his top economic advisers to study the possibility of re-entering the trade pact negotiations.
Mr. Trump has deputized Robert Lighthizer, the U.S. trade representative, and Larry Kudlow, the director of the National Economic Council, to study the possibility of re-entering the TPP if the terms were favorable, the president told a group of lawmakers on Thursday.
... RELATED VIDEO Trump and the New Era of Trade Policy President Donald Trump made a point on his first day in office in 2017 to formally remove the U.S. from the contentious trade agreement known as TPP. WSJ’s Gerald F. Seib explains how Trump’s campaign promises on trade might play out in the new administration. Photo: AP (Originally published Jan. 23, 2017)
